content.description:
Start on the right side of the sharp arete the is used for the

Butter

problem. Use the arete with your left hand, topping out at the apex of the face.
content.location:
It is immediately right of the arete on the

Butter

problem.

content.description:
To the left of

I Can't Believe It's Not Butter

is an obvious prow. Start with your right hand in the obvious pocket shared by

I Can't Believe It's Not Butter

and left on a cobble on the other side of the arete. Make your way up to the jug straight up the prow. I first did this dynamically, but there is an awesome heel-hook version that is much more fun but is seriously height-dependent.
content.location:
This is just left of

I Can't Believe It's Not Butter

halfway between the two aretes on the north face of the Butter Boulder.

Left side arete on the east face, left of

Honorary Grit

content.description: Slab o' Butter is a fun, little slab requiring foot work and use of a mono pocket. Start as far right as you can go on the west face of the Butter Boulder on two sidepulls and a little ramp for feet. Pull up to more sidepulls and a fun high step onto a slabby smear about hip level. Follow a couple small but good enough holds until you find yourself in the middle of the slab with a tiny crimp for your right hand and an amazing slot for your left. Find some good higher feet, and reach up high and left for the arete. Finish on jugs. This is fun stuff.
content.protection: 2+ pads and a spotter. Watch out for the landing on the rock. If you fall up high, you could hit a tree and/or a big rock. Be careful. It is best to have a couple pads and a spotter.
content.location:
This is two climbs to the right of the

Butter

Slab o' Butter problem and is the furthest right you can climb on the west face of the Butter Boulder.

climbs.name: I Can't Believe It's Not Butter

content.description: Climb the face using an oval pocket and small flakes.
content.location:
This is just left of

Butter

, also it faces the Stein Boulder.

content.description: Climb the arete on the right side.
content.location:
From

Butter

, you go left around the boulder to the east face (kind of diamond shaped).

content.description: From a sit start, hug the twin aretes and top out to the left.
